Joel Klein , 64, was in London at the behest of British Education Secretary Michael Gove to speak at a conference. He slammed teacher unions for allowing the bad apples to sour the system. The union is going to protect incompetent workers-- that is their job, said Joel Klein , who now works for News Corp., owner of The Post. Joel Klein remarked that unions are unhappy with the growth of high-performing charter schools because it threatens their "guaranteed client base."

state pupils Mrs Carolyn Roberts finds herself agreeing with Education Secretary Michael Gove 's new method for measuring school performance. She believes league tables have encouraged schools to discourage pupils from taking "harder" GCSEs. League tables have offered a perverse incentive to schools- schools have been tempted to provide courses that will confer league table success on the school, says Mrs Carolyn Roberts . The judge said: However pressing the economic problems, there was no overriding public interest which precluded consultation or justifies the lack of any consultation.
